title: Hiatal Hernia with Reflux Disease
diagnosis_topic: Sliding hiatal hernia associated with GERD symptoms
setup_script: A 55-year-old overweight woman complains of chronic heartburn, regurgitation and chest discomfort worsened when lying down. She has been on proton pump inhibitors for two years with partial relief.

dynamic_flow.reply: Typical GERD symptoms, nocturnal cough and hoarseness; occasional dysphagia; BMI 32 kg/m2.
Erosive esophagitis with Los Angeles grade B changes and a 3 cm sliding hiatal hernia.
Confirms sliding hiatal hernia and demonstrates reflux of contrast into the esophagus.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders esophageal pH monitoring and manometry
dynamic_flow.reply: Increased acid exposure time and normal peristalsis; LES pressure low.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident recommends lifestyle modifications and optimizes PPI therapy
dynamic_flow.reply: Weight loss, head of bed elevation, avoidance of late meals and acidic foods; increase PPI dose.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If symptoms persist or complications arise
dynamic_flow.reply: Candidate for surgical repair; discuss laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication (360) vs. partial wrap based on motility.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If paraesophageal component present or hernia >5 cm
dynamic_flow.reply: Surgical repair recommended even if asymptomatic to prevent strangulation.
Ensure adequate esophageal peristalsis to tolerate full wrap; manometry helps select appropriate fundoplication type.
Dysphagia common initially; avoid carbonated drinks and large meals; gradually progress diet.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident delays surgery in symptomatic hiatal hernia
dynamic_flow.reply: Risk of chronic esophagitis, Barrett's esophagus and pulmonary aspiration increases.
Importance of adherence to PPI therapy and lifestyle measures even after surgery for long-term control.

critical_decision_points: Evaluation of hiatal hernia and GERD with endoscopy, pH monitoring and manometry
Initial management with lifestyle modification and optimized medical therapy
Indications for surgical repair and selection of fundoplication technique
Preoperative assessment of esophageal motility to guide wrap type
Postoperative diet, dysphagia management and long-term acid suppression
